name: acetylpheneturide
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1196
Reason: 1,3-diphenylpropane has a melting point of 100 degrees Celsius. The introduction of an acetyl group (–COCH3) increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. However, the acetyl group also introduces a hydrogen bond acceptor, which can lower the melting point due to increased hydrogen bonding potential. The net effect should be a raised melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and size but a more significant decrease due to the additional hydrogen bonding potential.
